sentences.english: It is strictly forbidden to ill- treat and sell children and to use child labor.
sentences.chinese: 严格禁止虐待和拐卖儿童，禁止使用童工。

sentences.english: Like children in a bootblacking factory.
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子是擦鞋厂里的童工。

sentences.english: What do you think about child labor?
The company was infamously known for using child labour.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司因为使用童工而恶名昭彰。

sentences.english: 70 percent of all child labourers work in agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 所有童工中有70%从事农业劳动。

sentences.english: Comrade Li became a child laborer at10 and slaved away until liberation.
sentences.chinese: 童工，在解放前一直像奴隶般地干活。

sentences.english: The global area, child, with most asia-pacific countries more than 11 million.
sentences.chinese: 全球各地区中，亚太国家童工最多，以超过11亿。

sentences.english: A child migrant worker, left, picks tobacco leaves.
sentences.chinese: 一个跨境童工，左边的，在采摘烟叶。

sentences.english: There are 44 million child labourers in India.
sentences.chinese: 印度有四千四百万童工。

sentences.english: He has been running a lilt in the newspaper against child labour.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在报上攻击雇用童工。

sentences.english: Police raided the factory that was employing child laborers.
sentences.chinese: 警方抄查那个雇用童工的工厂。

sentences.english: The company should afford all the expenditure of sneding the child laborers back to their original inhabitance .
sentences.chinese: 童工被送回原居住地所需费用，全部由公司承担。

definition: forced labor (as punishment in criminal case)
working woman/variant of 女紅|女红[nu:3 gong1]
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
bitter work/hard toil/(loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times
